radiographic_examinations.findings: Fat stranding and inflammation of the pancreas, features consistent with pancreatitis; normal gallbladder; no evidence of dilatation or obstruction of the biliary tree.
Absence of cholelithiasis, cholecystitis, ascites, or loculated fluid collections; borderline splenomegaly; pancreas poorly visualized due to bowel gas.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal pancreas and pancreatic duct; normal common bile duct; no calculi; no pancreatic parenchymal necrosis.
Single, normal-size pancreatic duct; normal common bile duct; no evidence of pancreas divisum or annular pancreas.
